snippet: The average personal income in the richest state (Connecticut) was 1.8 times that in the poorest state (Mississippi) last year.
abstract: Ratio of average personal income in Conn, nation's richest state, to that of poorest state, Mississippi, was 1.8 in 2012; ratio in 1930 was 5.1, showing that disparity between richest and poorest states has shrunk dramatically in 80 years; pattern among individuals and families, however, remains same as in 1930, with top 1 percent of richest Americans receiving 17 percent of nation's total income.
lead_paragraph: The average personal income in the richest state (Connecticut) was 1.8 times that in the poorest state (Mississippi) last year.

headline.seo: Rich States, Poor States: Personal Income Disparity
